intro: Diapedium effusum, commonly known as the creeping diapedium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that root at the nodes. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the warmer months. Diapedium effusum is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
